name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Lock Picking and Physical Security
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Lock Picking and Physical Security
long_desc: The purpose of this class is to both study the wide array of techniques used in modernday security and to gain real skills in lock picking and bypass techniques. We will study the design of pin tumbler padlocks and deadbolts, which comprise the majority of locks one will encounter. Students will learn how to use singlepinpicking techniques to pick such locks. We will also look at bypass techniques such as unshielded padlock entry, bump keys, and padlock shimming. With this knowledge, students will be able to assess the security of their belongings and, of course, will never get locked out of their homes again. There is a fee of 30 per student to cover the cost of basic tools and a practice lock.

custom_fields.goals: Students will be better informed buyers of physical security items and will have developed a unique, useful skill.
custom_fields.key_topics: Pin tumbler, bypassing, decoding, wafter, tubular, and other locks studied. Single pin picking and raking picking techniques taught. Students will learn how to evaluate locks so that they may better protect their assets.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Attendance per the StuCo policy; hands-on midterm; written and hands-on final.
custom_fields.relevance: We all have items that need to be protected.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Course slides available to students whenever they need, additional learning resources are provided throughout the semester.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students must practice the techniques they learn in class (I stress that they must do this ethically) if they wish to pass the exams. Picking is a skill that takes many hours to become proficient at, which means students are required to practice outside of class time.
